intro: Puccinellia tzvelevii, commonly known as the Tzvelev's glassworts, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in saline or alkaline environments, such as coastal areas and salt marshes. The plant has slender, erect stems and small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Puccinellia tzvelevii plays a role in stabilizing soil in coastal regions and is often found in arid or semi-arid climates.
